page.title: 12FLOOD DAMAGE NEAR MENSTRIE
page.content: Between the 3rd and 4th of November 1984, the Hillfoots underwent their worst{disaster}for many years. As a result of very heavy rain the Carnaughton burn flooded,{landslides began, main pipes failed to work which resulted in the Cleuch estates sewage system overflowing. The{flooding}took place at such speed that many villagers were taken completely by surprise. Many home accesories were destroyed such as carpets, cookers and furniture. The dispersing water left a layer of black silt which covered many homes. Menstrie burn also burst its banks on the same night. It didn't have such devastating effects as it did in Alva but the force of water was great enough to uproot large trees.
